title: ICE: 'index out of bounds: the len is 10 but the index is 10', src/libcollections/vec.rs:1395

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
Rustc crashes on code that uses `phf` and `discord` crates.

I tried this code:

Cargo.toml:
```toml
[dependencies]
phf = {}
discord = { git = "https://github.com/SpaceManiac/discord-rs", default-features = false }

[build-dependencies]
phf_codegen = {}
```

(I was unable to reproduce this without discord crate so far)

main.rs:
```rust
extern crate phf;
extern crate discord;

use discord::Discord;
use discord::model::Message;

type Handler = fn(&Discord, Message) -> ();

fn hello(d: &Discord, m: Message) {
    println!("hello {:?}", m);
}

include!(concat!(env!("OUT_DIR"), "/codegen.rs"));

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```

build.rs:
```rust
extern crate phf_codegen;

use std::env;
use std::fs::File;
use std::io::{BufWriter, Write};
use std::path::Path;

fn main() {
    let path = Path::new(&env::var("OUT_DIR").unwrap()).join("codegen.rs");
    let mut file = BufWriter::new(File::create(&path).unwrap());

    write!(&mut file,
           "static KEYWORDS: phf::Map<&'static str, Handler> = ")
        .unwrap();
    phf_codegen::Map::new()
        .entry("help", "hello as fn(_, _)")
        .build(&mut file)
        .unwrap();
    write!(&mut file, ";\n").unwrap();
}
```

I expected to see this happen: cargo build works

Instead, this happened: 

